required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Implant Supported Single Crowns With Different Retention Modes
clinical_study.official_title: Implant Supported Single Crowns With Different Retention Modes - Effects on Peri-implant Tissue: A Prospective Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to examine the inflammatory response mediated by MMP-8 (Matrix metalloproteinase-8 ) level in peri-implant sulcus fluid adjacent to screw-retained, cemented or using the Acuris-system fixed single implant crowns as well as changing of the marginal bone level within the first year after implant restoration. Furthermore periodontal parameters, patient satisfaction and possible occurring biological or technical complications will be evaluated.

detailed_description.textblock: After giving their written consent volunteers will be screened and eligible subjects will be randomized to three different groups. In group 1 Acuris® is used as fixation type; in group 2 screw retention, and in group 3 cementation is used. After 3 months of submerged healing the dental implants will be restored with all ceramic single implant crowns, fixed by using the randomized fixation mode. Follow-up visits till one year after implant restoration will be performed. At least 11 study visits during 16 months will be conducted.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 4 months after implant placement and 3, 6 and 12 months after restoration
primary_outcome.description: assessed by single tooth x-ray; in mm

primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after implant placement, 3, 6 and 12 months after integration of the implant crown
primary_outcome.description: biomarker for Inflammation of peri-implant disease; in ng/ml

secondary_outcome.description: using a periodontal probe; in mm

secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured after integration of implant crown 3, 6 and 12 months after restoration
measured 4 months after implant placement and 3, 6 and 12 months after restoration
secondary_outcome.description: Papilla Index (Jemt T, 1997), the index ranges from 0 to 4, while 2 and 3 indicate physiological outcome

secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured at baseline, 3 and 12 months after restoration
secondary_outcome.description: evaluated using OHIP-G 14 questionnaire. The following dimensions are captured by the OHIP-G 14: functional Limitation (e.g., "pronouncing any words because of problems with your teeth, mouth, dentures, or jaw?") and physical Pain (e.g., "Have you had painful aching in your mouth"). 14 questions are raised, which are answered using a rating scale from 0 (never) to 4 (very often).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 4, 7, 10 and 16 months after implantation
at baseline, 4, 7, 10 and 16 months after implantation

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction concerning the implant crown

secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured after integration of implant crown 3, 6 and 12 months after restoration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of occurrences of screw loosening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured after integration of implant crown 3, 6 and 12 months after restoration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of occurrences of crown loosening
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured after integration of implant crown 3, 6 and 12 months after restoration

arm_group.description: single implant crown retention using friction only

intervention.description: implant crown retention type using friction only

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- capability of giving an informed consent
- good health as defined by the subjects medical history (no contraindications as described in the exclusion criteria below)
- age 18 to 99 years
- Good periodontal status: BOP < 20%, PI < 30%, no PD > 4mm
- No heavy smokers (< 10 cigarettes/day)
- at least 1 missing tooth in the premolar and molar region (with at least a mesial neighboring tooth/implant showing adequate hard- and soft tissue situation without the need of crestal hard- or soft tissue augmentation) either in the maxilla or in the mandible requiring implant therapy for reconstruction, requiring sinus floor augmentation or not.
Exclusion Criteria
- Insufficient bone volume for implant placement requiring GBR (guided bone regeneration) procedure in crestal area.
- Heavy Smokers (>10 cigarettes/day)
- Medication with a contraindication for implant therapy (especially antiresorptive therapy, ongoing or recently completed local radiotherapy, systematic diseases, ongoing immunosuppressive therapy, functional disorders like Bruxism).
- Skeletal immaturity.
- Any active malignancy or ongoing treatment for malignancy.
- An active infection (e.g. caries, gingivitis, periodontitis) at or in the neighboring area of the operative site.
- Pregnancy
- unable or unwilling to return for follow-up visits for a period of at least 16 months
